section.title: openedx.core.djangoapps.django_comment_common.comment_client.subscriptions module
section.paragraph: Subscription model is used to get users who are subscribed to the main thread/post i.e.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: Model
Subscription model is used to get users who are subscribed to the main thread/post i.e.
Fetches the subscriptions for a given thread_id
Bases: Model
Figure out whether we use forum v2 for a given thread.

This is a complex affair… First, we check the value of the DISABLE_FORUM_V2 setting, which overrides everything. If this setting does not exist, then we need to find the course ID that corresponds to the thread ID. Then, we return the value of the course waffle flag for this course ID.
Note that to fetch the course ID associated to a thread ID, we need to connect both to mongodb and mysql. As a consequence, when forum v2 needs adequate connection strings for both backends.

Check the forum connection via its built-in heartbeat service and create an answer which can be used in the LMS heartbeat django application. This function can be connected to the LMS heartbeat checker through the HEARTBEAT_CHECKS variable.

Returns a CourseKey if the provided course_id is a valid string representation of a CourseKey. If course_id is None or already a CourseKey object, it returns the course_id as is. :param course_id: The course ID to be converted. :type course_id: CourseKey | str | None

field_body.paragraph: The corresponding CourseKey object or None if the input is None.
KeyError – If course_id is not a valid string representation of a CourseKey.
